article.headline: Liberty 65, Coastal Carolina 51
article.story: CONWAY, S.C. (AP) -- B.J. Jenkins scored five of his 16 points during a decisive second-half run to lead Liberty past Coastal Carolina 65-51 in Big South Conference action Saturday. The Flames (14-12, 6-5 Big South) hit nine 3-pointers as they shot 44 percent from the field while holding the Chanticleers to just 33 percent. Liberty put the game away midway through the second half with a 12-0 run to take a 54-42 lead with 7:55 left. The Chanticleers (12-12, 5-6) had come back from an eight-point deficit just after the start of the second half to take a 1-point lead at 37-36 on two free throws by Phil Wallace with 13:55 left. But Liberty answered that challenge with six straight points. Coastal's Jack Leasure tied the game at 42 on a 3-pointer with 11:57 to go, but Liberty followed with its decisive run over the next four minutes. Anthony Smith led the Flames with 17 points and TeeJay Bannister added 11 points and a game-high seven assists. Leasure led Coastal (12-12, 5-6) with 17 points and Anthony Breeze added 14. Phil Wallace grabbed a game-high 14 rebounds and had eight points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
